The Great Storm (Acts 27:13–26)

\w Now|strong="H3588"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \w was|strong="H3220"\w* \w growing|strong="H1980"\w* worse \w and|strong="H1980"\w* worse, \w so|strong="H6213"\w* \w they|strong="H3588"\w* said \w to|strong="H1980"\w* Jonah, “\w What|strong="H4100"\w* must \w we|strong="H3068"\w* \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \w to|strong="H1980"\w* \w you|strong="H3588"\w* \w to|strong="H1980"\w* \w calm|strong="H8367"\w* \w this|strong="H6213"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \w for|strong="H3588"\w* \w us|strong="H5921"\w*?”

\w Nevertheless|strong="H3588"\w*, \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w men|strong="H1980"\w* \w rowed|strong="H2864"\w* \w hard|strong="H2864"\w* \f + \fr 1:13 \ft Hebrew the men dug in\f* \w to|strong="H1980"\w* \w get|strong="H1980"\w* \w back|strong="H7725"\w* \w to|strong="H1980"\w* \w dry|strong="H3004"\w* \w land|strong="H3004"\w*, \w but|strong="H3588"\w* \w they|strong="H3588"\w* \w could|strong="H3201"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w*, \w for|strong="H3588"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \w was|strong="H3808"\w* raging \w against|strong="H5921"\w* \w them|strong="H5921"\w* \w more|strong="H3808"\w* \w and|strong="H1980"\w* \w more|strong="H3808"\w*.

\w At|strong="H5975"\w* \w this|strong="H5375"\w*, \w they|strong="H5375"\w* \w picked|strong="H5375"\w* \w up|strong="H5375"\w* \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* \w and|strong="H5975"\w* \w cast|strong="H2904"\w* \w him|strong="H5975"\w* \w into|strong="H3220"\w* \w the|strong="H5375"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, \w and|strong="H5975"\w* \w the|strong="H5375"\w* \w raging|strong="H2197"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \w grew|strong="H5375"\w* calm.

Now the \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* had appointed \w a|strong="H3068"\w* great fish to swallow Jonah, and Jonah spent three days and three nights in the belly of the fish.
